name: wrike
description: Wrike is a project management and collaboration tool offering customizable workflows, Gantt charts, reporting, and resource management to boost team productivity

tools.name: WRIKE_BULK_MODIFY_GROUPS
tools.description: Adds or removes members for multiple Wrike groups in a single request; all specified user IDs must correspond to existing Wrike users.

inputSchema.title: BulkModifyGroupsRequest

items.title: BulkModifyGroupsmembersRequest

addMembers.title: Add Members
addMembers.description: User IDs to add to the group.

removeMembers.title: Remove Members
removeMembers.description: User IDs to remove from the group.

items.description: Specifies members to add or remove from a single Wrike group.

members.title: Members
members.description: List of group modification objects (max 20), each specifying a Wrike group and the members to add or remove.

inputSchema.description: Defines modifications for multiple Wrike groups, including members to add or remove.

tools.name: WRIKE_CREATE_FOLDER
tools.description: Creates a new Wrike subfolder within the specified `folderId`, optionally as a project if `customItemTypeId` is given; the folder is auto-shared with its creator.

inputSchema.title: CreateFolderRequest

title.title: Title
title.description: The title for the new folder.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: An optional list of field names to include in the response model, allowing for specific details about the created folder to be retrieved. Example fields include 'briefDescription', 'customFields', 'metadata', etc.

shareds.title: Shareds
shareds.description: A list of user IDs or invited user emails to share the folder with.

folderId.title: Folder Id
folderId.description: The unique identifier of the parent folder where the new subfolder will be created.

items.title: CreateFoldermetadataRequest
items.description: A single metadata entry for a folder. Wrike typically expects a key-value pair.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: A list of metadata entries (key-value pairs) to associate with the newly created folder.

description.title: Description
examples: Folder for all marketing assets related to the Q4 campaign.
description.description: An optional description for the new folder.

items.title: CreateFoldercustomFieldsRequest
items.description: A custom field for folder creation. Wrike typically expects an ID and value.

customFields.title: Custom Fields
customFields.description: A list of custom field entries (ID and value) to set for the new folder.

customColumns.title: Custom Columns
customColumns.description: A list of custom field IDs to be associated with the folder as columns. These typically control the visibility and order of custom fields in a table view.

userAccessRoles.title: User Access Roles
userAccessRoles.description: A dictionary mapping user IDs to their access roles for this folder (e.g., 'Editor', 'Limited', 'Full', 'Owner'). The key is the user ID and the value is the access role name.

withInvitations.title: With Invitations
withInvitations.description: A boolean flag indicating whether to include invited (pending) users in the 'ownerIds' and 'sharedIds' lists in the response.

customItemTypeId.title: Custom Item Type Id
customItemTypeId.description: The ID of a Custom Item Type. If provided, the created folder will be a project based on this type.

plainTextCustomFields.title: Plain Text Custom Fields
plainTextCustomFields.description: A boolean flag. If true, HTML tags will be stripped from custom field values.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a new folder.

tools.name: WRIKE_CREATE_GROUP
tools.description: Creates a new user group in Wrike with a specified title, optionally setting members, parent group, avatar, and custom metadata.

inputSchema.title: CreateGroupRequest

title.title: Title
title.description: The title or name of the new group.

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: The contact ID of an existing group to set as the parent for this new group. If omitted, the group will be a top-level group.

members.title: Members
members.description: List of Wrike user contact IDs to add as group members.

items.title: CreateGroupmetadataRequest

key.title: Key
key.description: Key for the metadata entry (must be less than 50 characters).

value.title: Value
value.description: Value for the metadata entry (must be less than 1000 characters). Use the string 'null' to remove an entry.

items.description: Defines a key-value pair for group metadata.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: List of key-value metadata entries to associate with the group.

avatar__color.title: Avatar  Color
avatar__color.description: The hex color code for the group's avatar background (e.g., '#FF0000' for red).

avatar__letters.title: Avatar  Letters
avatar__letters.description: Up to two characters to display as the group's avatar. For example, 'MT' for 'Marketing Team'.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a new group.

tools.name: WRIKE_CREATE_INVITATION
tools.description: Invites a user to a Wrike workspace by email, optionally with name, specifying EITHER `userTypeId` OR a combination of `role`/`external`; custom email subject/message available for paid accounts.

role.title: Role
role.description: Role for the invited user (e.g., 'Admin', 'Regular User', 'External User'). Cannot be used if `userTypeId` is specified. Can be combined with `external`.

email.title: Email
email.description: Email address of the user to invite.

message.title: Message
examples: Hello, please join our project on Wrike!
message.description: Custom message body for the invitation email (paid Wrike accounts only).

subject.title: Subject
examples: Invitation to join our Wrike workspace
subject.description: Custom subject for the invitation email (paid Wrike accounts only).

external.title: External
external.description: Flags invited user as external. Cannot be used if `userTypeId` is specified. Can be combined with `role`.

lastName.title: Last Name
lastName.description: Last name of the invited user.

firstName.title: First Name
firstName.description: First name of the invited user.

userTypeId.title: User Type Id
userTypeId.description: ID of the user type to assign (e.g., Admin, Regular User, External User). Cannot be used if `role` or `external` is specified.

tools.name: WRIKE_CREATE_TASK
tools.description: Creates a new task in a specified Wrike folder; if setting priority with `priorityBefore` or `priorityAfter`, the referenced task must be in the same folder or project.

inputSchema.title: CreateTaskRequest

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: JSON string array specifying optional fields to include in the task details of the response.

follow.title: Follow
follow.description: If `True`, the creator automatically follows the task.

status.title: Status
status.description: Status of the task. Note: This feature may not be available on the Team plan.

parents.title: Parents
parents.description: List of parent folder IDs for the task. Cannot include the recycleBinId.

shareds.title: Shareds
shareds.description: List of user or invitation IDs to share the task with; creator is auto-shared.

folderId.title: Folder Id
folderId.description: Unique identifier of the folder where the task will be created.

items.title: CreateTaskmetadataRequest

key.title: Key
key.description: The key for the metadata item.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value associated with the metadata key.

items.description: A single metadata key-value pair for a task.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: List of key-value metadata pairs for the task. Each item requires 'key' and 'value'.

followers.title: Followers
followers.description: List of user IDs to be added as task followers.

superTasks.title: Super Tasks
superTasks.description: List of task IDs to which this new task will be a subtask.

billingType.title: Billing Type
billingType.description: Billing type for the task's timelogs.

description.title: Description
examples: Review all department submissions and compile the final report.
Create a comprehensive plan for the new product launch.

items.title: CreateTaskcustomFieldsRequest
items.description: Specifies custom field data. Each entry in a `customFields` list should be an object with 'id' and 'value', e.g., `{"id": "custom_field_id", "value": "custom_field_value"}`.

customFields.title: Custom Fields
customFields.description: List of custom fields for the task. Each item requires `id` (custom field ID) and `value`. Refer to Wrike API documentation for value formatting based on type.

customStatus.title: Custom Status
customStatus.description: Unique ID of a custom status for the task.

responsibles.title: Responsibles
responsibles.description: List of user or invitation IDs to be assigned as responsible for the task.

priorityAfter.title: Priority After
priorityAfter.description: ID of an existing task to place the new task after in the list.

priorityBefore.title: Priority Before
priorityBefore.description: ID of an existing task to place the new task before in the list.

withInvitations.title: With Invitations
withInvitations.description: If `True`, include invited (unregistered) users in response's `shareds` and `responsibles`.

customItemTypeId.title: Custom Item Type Id
customItemTypeId.description: Unique ID of a Custom Item Type to use as a template for the task; task inherits its properties.

plainTextCustomFields.title: Plain Text Custom Fields
plainTextCustomFields.description: If `True`, HTML tags will be stripped from custom field values before saving.

responsiblePlaceholders.title: Responsible Placeholders
responsiblePlaceholders.description: List of placeholder IDs (Job Roles) to be assigned as responsible for the task.

inputSchema.description: Parameters for creating a new task in a Wrike folder.

tools.name: WRIKE_DELETE_CUSTOM_FIELD
tools.description: Permanently deletes a custom field by its ID; this action is irreversible and requires a valid, existing custom field ID.

customFieldId.title: Custom Field Id
customFieldId.description: The unique identifier of the custom field to be permanently deleted.

tools.name: WRIKE_DELETE_FOLDER
tools.description: Permanently deletes the folder specified by `folderId` and all its contents (e.g., tasks, documents, subfolders) from the Wrike workspace; this irreversible action is for when the folder is no longer needed and has no active tasks or dependencies that would block deletion.

folderId.title: Folder Id
folderId.description: The unique identifier of the folder to be deleted.

tools.name: WRIKE_DELETE_GROUP
tools.description: Permanently deletes a group by its `groupId`; this action is irreversible and does not affect user accounts that were members of the group.

groupId.title: Group Id
groupId.description: The unique identifier of the group to be deleted.

tools.name: WRIKE_DELETE_INIVTATION
tools.description: Permanently deletes an existing invitation, specified by its unique `invitationId`; this action cannot be undone.

invitationId.title: Invitation Id
invitationId.description: The unique identifier of the invitation to be deleted. This ID can be obtained when an invitation is created or by listing existing invitations.

tools.name: WRIKE_DELETE_TASK
tools.description: Permanently deletes a Wrike task and all its associated data by its ID; this action is irreversible and the task must exist.

inputSchema.title: DeleteTaskRequest

taskId.title: Task Id
taskId.description: The unique identifier of the task to be deleted.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for deleting a specific task by its ID.

tools.name: WRIKE_FETCH_ALL_TASKS
tools.description: Fetches tasks from a Wrike account, allowing filtering by status, due date, and subfolder inclusion, with customizable response fields and pagination.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: A list of field names to include for each task in the response. Author-related fields: 'responsibleIds' (assigned users), 'sharedIds' (users task is shared with), 'authorIds' (task creators), 'followerIds' (task followers). Other common fields: 'description', 'briefDescription', 'parentIds', 'superParentIds'. Custom fields can also be requested by their ID. If omitted, a default set of fields is returned. To include metadata in the response, add 'metadata' to this list.

status.title: Status
status.description: Filter tasks by their status. Only tasks matching the specified status will be returned (e.g., Active, Completed).

dueDate.title: DueDateFilter

end.title: End
end.description: End date for a due date range filter. Tasks due on or before this date will be included.

equal.title: Equal
equal.description: Exact due date to filter tasks by. If provided, this overrides 'start' and 'end' date filters.

start.title: Start
start.description: Start date for a due date range filter. Tasks due on or after this date will be included.

dueDate.description: Filter tasks by due date. Use 'equal' for an exact date match (yyyy-MM-dd), or 'start' and/or 'end' to define a date range (yyyy-MM-dd). If 'equal' is provided, 'start' and 'end' are ignored.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Filter tasks by metadata key-value pairs. Provide a dict of key-value pairs, e.g. {"department": "marketing", "region": "us"}. All pairs must match (AND logic).

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: The number of tasks to return per page.

descendants.title: Descendants
descendants.description: If true, tasks from all subfolders and subprojects are included. If false, only tasks from the specified folder/project are returned.

resolve_user_names.title: Resolve User Names
resolve_user_names.description: If true, automatically adds all user-related fields (authorIds, responsibleIds, sharedIds, followerIds) to the request and resolves user IDs to include user names and details directly in each task.

tools.name: WRIKE_GET_ACCOUNT_INFORMATION
tools.description: Retrieves detailed Wrike account information, where the response content is influenced by selected fields, account subscription, and user permissions.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Specifies field names to include in the response; if omitted, a default set of fields is returned.

tools.name: WRIKE_GET_ALL_CUSTOM_FIELDS
tools.description: Retrieves all custom field definitions (including ID, name, type, and settings) from the Wrike account; this returns the definitions themselves, not their specific values on Wrike items, and is useful for obtaining custom field IDs.

tools.name: WRIKE_GET_CONTACTS
tools.description: Retrieves a list of Wrike contacts (e.g., team members, clients, collaborators); response includes contact details but not their detailed task or project involvement.

inputSchema.title: GetContactsRequest

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: List of contact fields to include (e.g., 'firstName', 'email'); defaults to a standard set if omitted.

deleted.title: Deleted
deleted.description: Filter by deletion status: `true` for deleted, `false` or omitted (default) for active contacts.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Filter by a dictionary of metadata key-value pairs; returns contacts matching all specified pairs.

inputSchema.description: Parameters to filter and customize the retrieved list of Wrike contacts.

tools.name: WRIKE_GET_FOLDERS
tools.description: Retrieves folders and/or projects from Wrike, with filters; when using `nextPageToken`, all other filter parameters must match the initial request.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: List of optional fields to include in the response for each folder (Folders mode only).

deleted.title: Deleted
deleted.description: True to retrieve folders from the Recycle Bin; false or omitted to retrieve from Root.

project.title: Project
project.description: Filter by entity type: true for projects, false for folders. If omitted, both are returned.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Filter folders based on their metadata. Provide a dictionary object (not a JSON string) of metadata field names and their expected values.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Maximum number of folders per page (1-1000). Only "folders" kind is supported for pagination. When kind="folderTree", pageSize and nextPageToken are not supported.

permalink.title: Permalink
permalink.description: Folder permalink for an exact match.

descendants.title: Descendants
descendants.description: Include all descendant folders in the search scope; false to search only within the specified folder(s).

updatedDate.title: Updated Date
updatedDate.description: Filter folders by their last updated date. Provide a dictionary object (not a JSON string) with 'start', 'end', or 'equal' keys. Date format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssXXX.

items.title: GetFolderscustomFieldsRequest
items.description: Specifies custom field filters for `GetFolders`, adhering to Wrike API's structure (e.g., 'id' and 'value', or 'id', 'comparator', 'value').

customFields.title: Custom Fields
customFields.description: Filter folders by custom field values. Provide a list of filters, each specifying the custom field ID and value, or ID, comparator, and value. Example: `[{"id": "IEAGAAAAKZ7A____", "value": "Value"}]`.

contractTypes.title: Contract Types
contractTypes.description: Filter folders by a list of contract type IDs.

nextPageToken.title: Next Page Token
nextPageToken.description: Pagination token from a previous response to retrieve the next page. All other filter parameters must match the initial request. Only supported when kind="folders" (not supported for "folderTree").

customItemTypes.title: Custom Item Types
customItemTypes.description: Filter by a list of custom item type IDs. Standard types like 'project' or 'folder' IDs are not allowed.

withInvitations.title: With Invitations
withInvitations.description: Include invitations in the 'sharedIds' list of the response.

plainTextCustomFields.title: Plain Text Custom Fields
plainTextCustomFields.description: True to strip HTML tags from custom field values in the response.

tools.name: WRIKE_GET_INFORMATION_ABOUT_SPECIFIC_CONTACT
tools.description: Retrieves detailed information for a specific Wrike contact using their unique `contactId`, optionally including `metadata` and `customFields` if specified in the `fields` parameter.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Optional list of specific fields (e.g., `metadata`, `customFields`) to include; returns default fields if omitted.

contactId.title: Contact Id
contactId.description: The unique identifier of the contact to retrieve information for.

tools.name: WRIKE_GET_SPECIFIC_USER
tools.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific user in Wrike using their unique user ID.

userId.title: User Id
userId.description: The unique identifier of the user whose details are to be retrieved.

tools.name: WRIKE_GET_TASK_BY_ID
tools.description: Retrieves read-only detailed information for a specific Wrike task by its unique ID, optionally allowing specification of fields to include in the response.

inputSchema.title: GetTaskByIdRequest

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: A comma-separated list of optional fields to include in the response (e.g., 'recurrence,customFields,attachmentCount'). If not provided, a default set of fields will be returned.

taskId.title: Task Id
taskId.description: The unique identifier of the task to retrieve.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving a specific task by its unique identifier.

tools.name: WRIKE_LAUNCH_FOLDER_BLUEPRINT_ASYNC
tools.description: Asynchronously launches a new project or folder structure in Wrike from a specified Folder Blueprint, typically returning a task ID to track progress.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title for the new root folder created from the blueprint.

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: The unique identifier of the parent folder where the blueprint structure will be created.

entry_limit.title: Entry Limit
entry_limit.description: The maximum number of tasks and folders that can be created from the blueprint. This limit must be between 1 and 250, inclusive. If the blueprint contains more items, the operation may fail or be partially completed.

title_prefix.title: Title Prefix
title_prefix.description: A prefix to be added to the titles of all tasks and folders copied from the blueprint. If not provided, original titles are used.

reschedule_date.title: Reschedule Date
reschedule_date.description: The new start date for all rescheduled tasks in the format YYYY-MM-DD. If provided, tasks will be rescheduled based on this date and the reschedule_mode.

reschedule_mode.title: Reschedule Mode
reschedule_mode.description: Defines how tasks are rescheduled. Common modes might include shifting tasks relative to the reschedule_date or anchoring them. Consult Wrike API documentation for specific values. Examples: 'Preserve', 'Shift'.

copy_attachments.title: Copy Attachments
copy_attachments.description: If true, attachments from the blueprint will be copied. Defaults to true if not specified.

copy_descriptions.title: Copy Descriptions
copy_descriptions.description: Specifies whether to copy descriptions from the blueprint's tasks and folders. If true, descriptions are copied; otherwise, they are left empty. Defaults to true if not specified.

copy_responsibles.title: Copy Responsibles
copy_responsibles.description: If true, responsible assignments from the blueprint will be copied to the new tasks. Defaults to true if not specified.

copy_custom_fields.title: Copy Custom Fields
copy_custom_fields.description: If true, custom field values from the blueprint will be copied to the new tasks and folders. Defaults to true if not specified.

folder_blueprint_id.title: Folder Blueprint Id
folder_blueprint_id.description: The unique identifier of the folder blueprint to be launched.

notify_responsibles.title: Notify Responsibles
notify_responsibles.description: If true, users assigned as responsibles for tasks in the blueprint will be notified. Defaults to true if not specified.

tools.name: WRIKE_LAUNCH_TASK_BLUEPRINT_ASYNC
tools.description: Asynchronously launches a Wrike Task Blueprint to create tasks/projects, requiring either `super_task_id` (parent task) or `parent_id` (parent folder/project) for placement.

title.title: Title
title.description: Title for the root task created from the blueprint.

parent_id.title: Parent Id
parent_id.description: ID of an existing parent folder/project for the new task(s); either this or `super_task_id` is required.

entry_limit.title: Entry Limit
entry_limit.description: Maximum number of tasks/folders to copy from blueprint (1-250).

title_prefix.title: Title Prefix
title_prefix.description: Prefix for titles of all tasks created from this blueprint.

super_task_id.title: Super Task Id
super_task_id.description: ID of an existing parent task for the new task(s); either this or `parent_id` is required.

reschedule_date.title: Reschedule Date
reschedule_date.description: Target date (yyyy-MM-dd) for rescheduling tasks; requires `reschedule_mode`.

reschedule_mode.title: Reschedule Mode
reschedule_mode.description: How tasks are rescheduled if `reschedule_date` is set; valid values: `RescheduleStartDate`, `RescheduleFinishDate`.

copy_attachments.title: Copy Attachments
copy_attachments.description: Copy attachments from blueprint tasks to new tasks.

copy_descriptions.title: Copy Descriptions
copy_descriptions.description: Copy blueprint task descriptions to new tasks; if false or omitted, new tasks will have empty descriptions.

copy_responsibles.title: Copy Responsibles
copy_responsibles.description: Assign users responsible for blueprint tasks to the newly created tasks.

task_blueprint_id.title: Task Blueprint Id
task_blueprint_id.description: Unique identifier of the task blueprint to launch.

copy_custom_fields.title: Copy Custom Fields
copy_custom_fields.description: Copy custom field values from blueprint tasks to new tasks.

notify_responsibles.title: Notify Responsibles
notify_responsibles.description: Notify users responsible for blueprint tasks when new tasks are created.

tools.name: WRIKE_LIST_FOLDER_BLUEPRINTS
tools.description: Retrieves all account-level Folder Blueprints, which are templates for standardizing folder/project creation with predefined structures, custom fields, and workflows.

inputSchema.title: ListFolderBlueprintsRequest
inputSchema.description: An empty request to list all account-level Folder Blueprints.

tools.name: WRIKE_LIST_SPACE_FOLDER_BLUEPRINTS
tools.description: Lists all folder blueprints (templates for new folders/projects) within a specified Wrike space, requiring a valid and accessible space ID.

space_id.title: Space Id
space_id.description: The unique identifier of the Wrike space from which to list folder blueprints.

tools.name: WRIKE_LIST_SPACE_TASK_BLUEPRINTS
tools.description: Lists task blueprints (templates for creating tasks with consistent structures) available in a specific, accessible Wrike space.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum total number of task blueprints to return.

space_id.title: Space Id
space_id.description: Unique identifier of the Wrike space from which to list task blueprints.

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: Number of task blueprints to return per page for pagination.

next_page_token.title: Next Page Token
next_page_token.description: Token from the previous page's response to retrieve the next page of results; if empty or omitted, fetches the first page.

tools.name: WRIKE_LIST_SUBFOLDERS_BY_FOLDER_ID
tools.description: Lists subfolders (metadata only, not their contents) for an existing Wrike folder specified by `folderId`, supporting recursive descent, filtering, and pagination.

inputSchema.title: ListSubfoldersByFolderIdRequest

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Optional fields to include in the response for each folder (e.g., 'metadata', 'customFields').

project.title: Project
project.description: Set true for projects only, false for regular folders only; omit for both or API default.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Filters folders by metadata using a dictionary of key-value pairs for exact match.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Maximum folders per page (API default e.g., 100, max 1000).

permalink.title: Permalink
permalink.description: Permalink for an exact match search of the folder to fetch subfolders from.

descendants.title: Descendants
descendants.description: Set to true to include all descendant subfolders; false for direct children only.

updatedDate.title: Updated Date
updatedDate.description: Filters folders by last updated date using comparators (e.g., 'LessThan', 'EqualTo') or a date range ('start', 'end' keys). Dates: 'yyyy-MM-dd' or 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ'.

items.title: ListSubfoldersByFolderIdcustomFieldsRequest
items.description: Defines a filter criterion for a custom field, requiring a structure like `{'id': 'fieldId', 'comparator': 'EqualTo', 'value': 'matchValue'}` as per Wrike API documentation.

customFields.title: Custom Fields
customFields.description: Filters folders by custom field values using a list of filter objects (e.g., `{'id': 'customFieldId', 'comparator': 'EqualTo', 'value': 'FieldValue'}`). Refer to Wrike API documentation for detailed structure.

contractTypes.title: Contract Types
contractTypes.description: Filters projects by contract type names; mainly used when `project` is true.

nextPageToken.title: Next Page Token
nextPageToken.description: Token from a previous response's `nextPageToken` field for pagination; other filters should match the initial request.

customItemTypes.title: Custom Item Types
customItemTypes.description: Filters by a list of custom item type IDs (standard types like 'Project' or 'Folder' are not applicable).

withInvitations.title: With Invitations
withInvitations.description: If true, includes invited (but not yet accepted) users in `sharedIds` of returned folders.

plainTextCustomFields.title: Plain Text Custom Fields
plainTextCustomFields.description: If true, strips HTML tags from custom field values in the response.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for listing subfolders within a specific folder, with filtering and pagination.

tools.name: WRIKE_LIST_TASK_BLUEPRINTS
tools.description: Retrieves a list of defined Task Blueprints (predefined task templates) from the Wrike account, supporting pagination.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: The maximum number of Task Blueprints to be returned in the API response. The Wrike API enforces a maximum value of 1000 for this parameter. Default is 1000.

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: The number of Task Blueprints to include per page when paginating results. This parameter works in conjunction with `next_page_token`. Default is 100.

next_page_token.title: Next Page Token
next_page_token.description: An opaque token for fetching the next page of Task Blueprints. This token is obtained from the `nextPageToken` field in a previous API response. If omitted or empty, the first page is retrieved. Providing this token might cause the API to ignore other filter parameters.

tools.name: WRIKE_MODIFY_ACCOUNT
tools.description: Updates or adds custom key-value metadata to the Wrike account, useful for integrations, storing app-specific data, or mapping external system identifiers.

key.title: Key
key.description: The metadata key. Must be less than 50 characters and consist of alphanumeric characters, underscores, or hyphens (matches regex pattern: `^[A-Za-z0-9_-]+$`).

value.title: Value
value.description: The metadata value. Must be a JSON-compatible string and less than 1000 characters. To remove an existing metadata entry, provide the JSON string `"null"` as its value.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: A list of metadata key-value pairs to update or add to the account. Metadata entries are isolated on a per-client (application) basis. If an empty list is provided or the field is omitted, no metadata changes will occur.

tools.name: WRIKE_MODIFY_FOLDER
tools.description: Modifies an existing Wrike folder: updates title, description, parents (not root/recycle bin), sharing, metadata, custom fields/columns; restores, converts to project, or manages access roles.

inputSchema.title: ModifyFolderRequest

title.title: Title
title.description: The new title for the folder.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: A list of optional field names to be included in the response model. Example: `["parentIds", "sharedIds", "customFields"]`.

restore.title: Restore
restore.description: Set to true to restore the folder if it is currently in the Recycled Bin.

folderId.title: Folder Id
folderId.description: Unique identifier of the folder to be modified.

items.title: ModifyFoldermetadataRequest
items.description: A single metadata item for updating the folder, typically a key-value pair defined by Wrike's metadata fields.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: List of metadata entries (key-value pairs) to update for the folder.

addParents.title: Add Parents
addParents.description: Parent folder IDs to add. Must be from the same Wrike account and not be rootFolderId or recycleBinId.

addShareds.title: Add Shareds
addShareds.description: A list of user IDs or invitation IDs with whom to share the folder.

description.title: Description
examples: Contains all documents and tasks related to Q3 planning for Project Alpha.
description.description: The new description for the folder.

items.title: ModifyFoldercustomFieldsRequest
items.description: A single custom field to update or delete, identified by its 'id'. Provide a 'value', or null to clear it.

customFields.title: Custom Fields
customFields.description: Custom fields to update or delete. Each object needs an 'id' and 'value'; pass the ID with a null value to clear.

customColumns.title: Custom Columns
customColumns.description: A list of custom field IDs to be displayed as columns for this folder in the Wrike interface.

removeParents.title: Remove Parents
removeParents.description: Parent folder IDs to remove. Must be from the same Wrike account and not be rootFolderId or recycleBinId.

removeShareds.title: Remove Shareds
removeShareds.description: A list of user IDs or invitation IDs from whom to unshare the folder.

addAccessRoles.title: Add Access Roles
addAccessRoles.description: User IDs mapped to Wrike access roles (e.g., 'Full', 'Editor', 'Limited', 'Read Only') to assign for this folder. Example: `{"KUAJ25LC": "Editor", "KUAJ25LD": "Full"}`.

withInvitations.title: With Invitations
withInvitations.description: Set to true to include pending invitations in the 'ownerIds' and 'sharedIds' lists within the response.

removeAccessRoles.title: Remove Access Roles
removeAccessRoles.description: A list of user IDs whose specific access roles for this folder should be revoked.

clearCustomColumns.title: Clear Custom Columns
clearCustomColumns.description: Set to true to remove all custom field column associations from this folder.

plainTextCustomFields.title: Plain Text Custom Fields
plainTextCustomFields.description: Set to true to strip any HTML tags from custom field values during the update operation, saving them as plain text.

convertToCustomItemType.title: Convert To Custom Item Type
convertToCustomItemType.description: The ID of a Custom Item Type. If provided, the folder will be converted into a project of this specified custom item type.

inputSchema.description: Request to modify attributes of a specified folder.

tools.name: WRIKE_MODIFY_GROUP
tools.description: Updates an existing Wrike user group's attributes like title, members, parent, avatar, or metadata, using its `groupId` and specifying only the fields to change.

inputSchema.title: ModifyGroupRequest

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: ID of an existing group to set as parent for hierarchical organization.

groupId.title: Group Id
groupId.description: Unique ID of the group to modify.

items.title: ModifyGroupmetadataRequest

value.title: Value
value.description: Value for the metadata key (max 1000 chars); can be text, number, boolean, or stringified JSON. Use '"null"' to remove.

items.description: Individual metadata key-value pair for a group.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Custom metadata key-value pairs to update. Existing keys are updated, new ones added. To remove, set value to '"null"'.

addMembers.title: Add Members
addMembers.description: Wrike User IDs to add to the group. Users must exist.

removeMembers.title: Remove Members
removeMembers.description: Wrike User IDs to remove from the group.

addInvitations.title: Add Invitations
addInvitations.description: User IDs of invited users (pending Wrike invitation) to add to the group.

avatar__letters.title: Avatar  Letters
avatar__letters.description: New avatar letters for the group (max 2 chars, e.g., 'RD').

removeInvitations.title: Remove Invitations
removeInvitations.description: User IDs of invited users to remove from the group.

inputSchema.description: Modifies an existing Wrike group's attributes.

tools.name: WRIKE_MODIFY_TASK
tools.description: Modifies an existing Wrike task by its ID, allowing updates to attributes such as title, status, dates, assignees, and custom fields; `priorityBefore` and `priorityAfter` are mutually exclusive, and parent folder IDs for `addParents`/`removeParents` cannot be the Recycle Bin.

inputSchema.title: ModifyTaskRequest

dates.title: Dates
dates.description: A dictionary specifying the task's date-related attributes. Allowed keys include `type` (e.g., 'Planned', 'Actual'), `duration` (in minutes), `start` (YYYY-MM-DD), `due` (YYYY-MM-DD), and `workOnWeekends` (boolean).

title.title: Title
title.description: The new title for the task.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: A list of optional field names to be included in the response object. Provide a list of strings, where each string is a valid field key. For example, `["recurrence", "responsibleIds"]`.

follow.title: Follow
follow.description: Set to `true` to make the current API user follow the task, or `false` to unfollow.

status.title: Status
status.description: The new status of the task. This field is not available for accounts on the Team plan.

taskId.title: Task Id
taskId.description: The unique identifier of the task to be modified.

restore.title: Restore
restore.description: Set to `true` to restore the task if it is currently in the Recycle Bin.

items.title: MetadataRequest

key.title: Key
key.description: The key of the metadata entry. Must conform to the pattern: ^[A-Za-z0-9_-]+$.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value associated with the metadata key.

items.description: Request schema for defining a metadata key-value pair.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: A list of metadata key-value pairs to update. Providing a `null` value for an existing key's `value` will remove that entry.

addParents.title: Add Parents
addParents.description: A list of folder IDs to which the task will be added (i.e., moved into). Cannot include the Recycle Bin folder ID.

addShareds.title: Add Shareds
addShareds.description: A list of user IDs or invitation IDs with whom the task will be shared.

importance.title: Importance
importance.description: The new importance level of the task.

billingType.title: Billing Type
billingType.description: Specifies the billing type for the task's timelogs.

description.title: Description
examples: Update the project plan with the latest timelines.
Check Trello board for new tickets, attach details here.
description.description: The new detailed description for the task. Supports HTML formatting.

addFollowers.title: Add Followers
addFollowers.description: A list of user IDs to be added as followers to the task. Followers receive notifications about task updates.

items.title: CustomFieldsRequest
items.description: Represents an entry for updating a custom field, expected to contain `id` and `value`.

customFields.title: Custom Fields
customFields.description: A list of custom field updates. Each object should specify the `id` of the custom field and its new `value`. To remove a custom field's value, set `value` to `null` (or an empty string for certain types). Example: `{"id": "customFieldId123", "value": "newValue"}`.

customStatus.title: Custom Status
customStatus.description: The ID of the custom status to apply to the task. This is used when custom workflows are enabled in the Wrike account.

addSuperTasks.title: Add Super Tasks
addSuperTasks.description: A list of task IDs that will become parent tasks to the current task, effectively making the current task a subtask of each specified task.

priorityAfter.title: Priority After
priorityAfter.description: The ID of an existing task after which the current task should be placed in the task list, determining its priority. Mutually exclusive with `priorityBefore`.

removeParents.title: Remove Parents
removeParents.description: A list of folder IDs from which the task will be removed. Cannot include the Recycle Bin folder ID.

removeShareds.title: Remove Shareds
removeShareds.description: A list of user IDs or invitation IDs from whom the task will be unshared.

priorityBefore.title: Priority Before
priorityBefore.description: The ID of an existing task before which the current task should be placed in the task list, determining its priority. Mutually exclusive with `priorityAfter`.

addResponsibles.title: Add Responsibles
addResponsibles.description: A list of user IDs or invitation IDs to be added to the task's assignee list.

withInvitations.title: With Invitations
withInvitations.description: Set to `true` to include pending invitations in the `sharedIds` and `responsibleIds` fields within the response data. Default is `false`.

removeSuperTasks.title: Remove Super Tasks
removeSuperTasks.description: A list of task IDs from which the current task will be removed as a subtask.

removeResponsibles.title: Remove Responsibles
removeResponsibles.description: A list of user IDs or invitation IDs to be removed from the task's assignee list.

plainTextCustomFields.title: Plain Text Custom Fields
plainTextCustomFields.description: Set to `true` to strip HTML tags from custom field values before saving. If `false`, HTML content is preserved. API defaults to `false` behavior if not provided.

convertToCustomItemType.title: Convert To Custom Item Type
convertToCustomItemType.description: The ID of a Custom Item Type to which this task should be converted. This changes the task's type and may alter its available custom fields and behavior.

addResponsiblePlaceholders.title: Add Responsible Placeholders
addResponsiblePlaceholders.description: A list of placeholder IDs to be added to the task's placeholder assignee list. Placeholders represent roles or groups.

removeResponsiblePlaceholders.title: Remove Responsible Placeholders
removeResponsiblePlaceholders.description: A list of placeholder IDs to be removed from the task's placeholder assignee list.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for modifying an existing task. At least one updatable field must be provided in addition to `taskId`.

tools.name: WRIKE_QUERY_CUSTOMFIELDS
tools.description: Retrieves a Wrike custom field's detailed information (e.g., type, possible values for dropdowns), properties, and metadata; the `customFieldId` must correspond to an existing custom field.

customFieldId.title: Custom Field Id
customFieldId.description: Unique identifier of the custom field.

tools.name: WRIKE_QUERY_INVITATIONS
tools.description: Retrieves all active invitations in Wrike, useful for viewing and auditing pending invitations or managing user onboarding.

tools.name: WRIKE_QUERY_SPECIFIC_GROUP
tools.description: Retrieves detailed information for a specific Wrike group using its `groupId`, optionally including 'metadata'.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Specifies a list of optional fields to be included in the response. The only valid value to pass in the list is 'metadata', which will include group metadata. If omitted or an empty list is provided, a default representation of the group is returned.

groupId.title: Group Id
groupId.description: The unique identifier of the Wrike group whose details are to be retrieved.

tools.name: WRIKE_QUERY_WORKFLOWS
tools.description: Fetches a list of all workflows with their detailed information from the Wrike account; this is a read-only action and does not support pagination or filtering through its parameters.

inputSchema.title: QueryWorkflowsRequest
inputSchema.description: Request to query all Wrike workflows.

tools.name: WRIKE_RETRIEVE_LIST_OF_GROUPS
tools.description: Retrieves a list of user groups from the Wrike account, supporting metadata filtering, pagination, and inclusion of specific fields; this is a read-only operation.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Optional fields to include per group; only 'metadata' (custom key-value pairs) is currently supported. Default fields are returned if omitted.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Filters groups by exact match on custom metadata; keys are field IDs/names, values are expected metadata.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Maximum group entries per page for pagination; API default applies if omitted.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Token from a previous response's 'nextPageToken' to get the next page; typically overrides other query parameters.

tools.name: WRIKE_UPDATE_CUSTOM_FIELD_BY_ID
tools.description: Updates properties of an existing Wrike custom field by its ID, such as its title, type, scope, or sharing settings.

type.title: Type
type.description: New type for the custom field. Changing this can affect existing data.

title.title: Title
title.description: New title for the custom field.

sharing.title: Sharing
sharing.description: Defines access settings, superseding `addShareds` and `removeShareds`. Expected format is an array of objects, e.g., `[{"accessorId": "ID", "accessType": "ReadOnly | ReadWrite"}]`.

spaceId.title: Space Id
spaceId.description: ID of the Space. Required if `changeScope` is 'AccountToSpace' or when changing a space-level custom field's space association.

settings.title: Settings
settings.description: Settings specific to the custom field type, e.g., list values for 'DropDown', decimal places for 'Numeric'. Structure varies by 'type'.

addMirrors.title: Add Mirrors
addMirrors.description: List of custom field IDs to add as mirrors. Applicable only to 'LinkToDatabase' custom fields.

changeScope.title: Change Scope
changeScope.description: Specifies if the custom field's scope should change. Use 'AccountToSpace' (requires `spaceId`) to convert an account-level field to space-level, or 'SpaceToAccount' to convert a space-level field to account-level.

customFieldId.title: Custom Field Id
customFieldId.description: Identifier of the custom field to be updated.

removeMirrors.title: Remove Mirrors
removeMirrors.description: List of custom field IDs to remove as mirrors. Applicable only to 'LinkToDatabase' custom fields.

tools.name: WRIKE_UPDATE_INVITATION
tools.description: Updates a pending Wrike invitation (`invitationId`) to resend it or change user's role/type (use `userTypeId` over deprecated `role`/`external`).

role.title: Role
role.description: [DEPRECATED] User's role (e.g., 'User', 'Collaborator'); prefer 'userTypeId'. Mutually exclusive with 'userTypeId'.

resend.title: Resend
resend.description: Resends the invitation email if true.

external.title: External
external.description: [DEPRECATED] Marks user as external; prefer 'userTypeId'. Requires 'role' to be 'User'. Mutually exclusive with 'userTypeId'.

userTypeId.title: User Type Id
userTypeId.description: User type ID determining role/permissions. Recommended; mutually exclusive with 'role'/'external'.

invitationId.title: Invitation Id
invitationId.description: Unique identifier of the invitation to modify.

tools.name: WRIKE_UPDATE_METADATA_ON_SPECIFIC_CONTACT
tools.description: Updates metadata, job role, or custom fields for an existing Wrike contact specified by `contactId`; if `jobRoleId` is provided, it must be a valid ID.

inputSchema.title: UpdateMetadataOnSpecificContactRequest

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Optional list of field names to include in the response. If provided, only these fields will be returned.

items.title: UpdateMetadataOnSpecificContactmetadataRequest
items.description: Represents a single metadata key-value pair to be updated for the contact.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: List of metadata key-value pairs to update. Users typically have read/write access to their own metadata; other entries may be read-only.

contactId.title: Contact Id
contactId.description: Unique identifier of the contact to update.

jobRoleId.title: Job Role Id
jobRoleId.description: Unique identifier of the job role to assign, which updates the contact's current role.

items.title: UpdateMetadataOnSpecificContactcustomFieldsRequest
items.description: Represents a custom field update, typically containing its ID and new value.

customFields.title: Custom Fields
customFields.description: List of custom field updates. Each item should specify the custom field and its new value. Providing a null value might remove the custom field, depending on API behavior.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for updating details of a specific contact.

tools.name: WRIKE_UPDATE_SPECIFIC_USER
tools.description: Updates specified profile attributes (e.g., account ID, role, external status) for an existing Wrike user; unspecified fields remain unchanged.

userId.title: User Id
userId.description: Unique identifier for the user whose profile is to be updated.

profile__role.title: Profile  Role
profile__role.description: Role to assign to the user's profile.

profile__external.title: Profile  External
profile__external.description: Indicates if the user is an external user.

profile__accountId.title: Profile  Account Id
profile__accountId.description: Unique identifier of the account to associate with the user's profile.
